title: Print, "Design for a Grotto Room", 1753
medium: Etching and engraving on white laid paper tipped into cream laid paper
signed: Signed in plate, lower left: Hoppenhaupt, Senior 1753; lower right: I. W. Meil del et inci.
dimensions:
Sheet: 40.6 x 64.1 cm (16 in. x 25 1/4 in.)
Platemark: 40.6 x 58.8 cm (16 in. x 23 1/8 in.)
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Interior showing clock, benches with legs made of wooden pieces placed in diagonal formation with leaves; back of benches decorated with fish scales and framed by curves and fantastic plants. Centerpiece clock in rounded niche with nude figures perched on top, woman with vegetal headdress, draping foliage; sides, two niches with infants and draping plants and fountains.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "Design for a Grotto Room", 1753.
1753. Etching and engraving on white laid paper tipped into cream laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1921-6-221-8.
